name: InterContinental Bangkok

reviews.text: An outstanding intercontinental hotel, great staff, great location, and fine dinning. The rooms are large and the views of the BKK jungle are brilliant.
reviews.title: Asian opulence at its best.

reviews.text: Italian restaurant is great and the balcony lounge is relaxing with good WiFi (Skype).
reviews.title: Excellent location, service & amenities

reviews.text: The ambassador club has great views and amenities, but the breakfast is not as varied as the main dinning room.

reviews.text: A repeat customer with high regard for the location. Their can double in a week so book early.
reviews.title: Very good stay at the heart of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My company recently switched from the JW Marriott to the Intercon for our trips to Bangkok. I have stayed here on three separate occasions and overall, I'm impressed and have found their service consistent. I'll list some pros & cons below:
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service and Great Breakfast Buffet!

reviews.text: I booked the Intercontinental Limousine service so that I had a 7 series BMW waiting when I landed at Bangkok airport, I was met by a conceirge at the gate who then called the driver and I was in the car within 5 minutes. The car had nice big size refreshing towels in nice IC branded packaging, water, magazines etc.
reviews.title: WOW! Fantastic Hotel Did not want to leave...

reviews.text: On arrival at the Hotel I had four people waiting for me! one to open my door, one to carry my case, a security to guy and one of the reception staff from the club lounge on the 37th floor, within minutes i was sat in the Intercontinental Club lounge that is up on the top floor next to the entrance of the swimming pool. I am an Ambassador member of Intercontinental so the upgrade of my room to a King Club was for free and what a treat. Check in was flawless whilst I sipped a champagne cocktail.
reviews.title: 5 star treatment in a 5 star hotel

reviews.text: I was on 27th floor and room was both spacious and comfortable with seperate seating area and huge super king size bed with egyptian cotton and the most comfortable bed EVER! they have these really thick mattress toppers that are so comfy. My room also had a 50" Plasma screen with DVD player, ipod dock, alarm clock radio.
reviews.title: Try the intercon bkk once, and you'll be hooked!
Excellent business class hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed at the IC twice now, and it continues to impress more and more. on many previous visits to BKK I have chosen The Oriental. My initial reason for changing was simply price, The IC is MUCH better value for money. It may not have the river frontage of the MO, but it is far more convienientl located for ease of travelling around this hectic but highly enjoyable city.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in Bangkok

reviews.text: The service from start to finish is exceptional. I would reccomend a Intercontinental club room, as the lounge is fantastic. If one didnt want to spend any money on eating out, which would be crazy,there is no need to as ther evening "nibbles" are great. My waist line is a true beliver in that!!!!
reviews.title: Great Welcoming

reviews.text: Pool area whilst good does let it down a little bit, but not enough to spoil the experience.

reviews.text: without fail a really top quality hotel in every respect.
reviews.title: One of the best hotel in Bangkok

reviews.text: As an Intercontinental Ambassador I am sad to write this review. We have always loved this hotel and continue to love certain people at the Intercon BKK.
reviews.title: So sadly disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As my wife is Thai we understand everything that is being said and are not in the dark about anything. As we were having a wedding in Thailand we had guests from everywhere visiting us and they are staying in the adjoining Holiday Inn. As my wife had some of her family there (thai) the elevator guy made a horrible comment toy wife and her friend at 10am about having people visit. We understand after 9pm when people may decide to sleep 10 in a room lol but this was not the case. In this case the elevator guy should have used his brain, asked the front desk people about what room they were going to in order to confirm we were customers but also platinum ambassadors. My wife and her family are now disgusted by this one event and we have vowed never to stay at Intercon Bangkok again. This is because they feel everything is a fake show and the second someone walks away the staff are saying something rude and cruel about their guests. Sorry Intercon but we will no longer be stepping through your doors.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: Overall, had an amazing stay at the InterContinental in Bangkok and it was probably one of my best hotel experiences ever.
reviews.title: Good Location and Great Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went for our honeymoon, and the hotel actually gave us some champagne and chocolates. The rooms were extremely comfortable, luxurious and very spacious. An added bonus: we had a nice view. The staff was incredibly friendly, professional and thoughtful (they found out it was my birthday one of the nights and sent me flowers).
reviews.title: Thank you!

reviews.text: The pool is on the 35th floor overlooking the city and is beautiful. Although we didn't use it, the fitness center had nice equipment and was spacious. The hotel had a business center in which we could use their computer/internet free of charge (no free wifi in the rooms).
reviews.title: Simply amazing

reviews.text: IC BKK is located very close to the giant shopping center the Central, where you can find excellent food and plenty of shops. The mall across the street is smaller but has lots of choices too, including a pharmacy. The sky train is also steps away. The hotel looks new, and staff is generally friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet is fine with plenty of choices, nothing exceptional though. We paid less than USD200 a night including free internet and breakfast for this 5 star property, and it seems a good value.
reviews.title: Convenient location, good value

reviews.text: When arriving Bkk I would have thought that this place could be great and even the best as far what I have ridden around
reviews.title: Good place but not the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a matter of fact it is very good place indeed for its location but not really the best hotel I have ever been in service/hotel rooms point of view
reviews.title: 1st class hotel in the centre of Bangkok

reviews.text: That being said I spent a very good time there !
reviews.title: If you are going to spend the money for a first class hotel, go ahead and get the club rooms.

reviews.text: Enjoy Bangkok !
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous

reviews.text: I spent two nights here at the start of my business trip to Vietnam and Thailand. Check-in was quite easy, however I had to wait several hours for my room to be prepared, despite advising the hotel that I would be arriving early. It would have been nice if I'd been directed to somewhere I could have got a coffee while waiting, but there is a Starbucks across the road. The lobby area is very smart, and a good place for meetings.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel

reviews.text: My room was lovely: well furnished with an ipod dock and sockets which used various plugs. The bathroom had a great shower with two types of head. Between meetings I spent my time by the pool on the 37th floor. This was lovely - cold enough to be refreshing, and the staff were really good.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with unbeatable location

reviews.text: I ordered a room service breakfast on the day I checked out, and sadly the poached eggs were overcooked, but hey if that's the only problem, that's not bad!
reviews.title: fantastic stay

reviews.text: My only quibble (and this is as much my fault for not knowing the city very well) is that when I asked one of the doormen for directions to Siam SkyTrain I was sent to the nearer BTS station instead, which isn't on the Silom line. This made me very late for my meeting. Having said this, now I know my way a bit better, I would definately stay here again
reviews.title: Service oriented Intercontinental

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 6D5N and found mostly everything is perfect. First, the check in process is very sufficient, the receptionist manage to get me excellent room with great view. Further, most of the staff always smile and efficiently assist us throughout the stay. The hotel and facilities are nice and well-kept, everything is clean and in good shape. The room is spotless and the spa+fitness center is located on the highest floor which give you a very great Bangkok view on day and Night.
reviews.title: Best Business Hotel in Bangkok - Thank you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's not the first time I've stayed at InterContinental Bangkok but I can say that it's certainly not going to be the last.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, the natural draw is the location of the hotel. On prime location sitting underneath Chit Lom BTS station. This proves to be v. important because transportation and traffic needs to be highly considered when getting around in Bangkok. The BTS is clean, safe and pretty easier in getting around.
reviews.title: Perfect again, as always

reviews.text: The hotel service and staff who make up the service were remarkable. Concierge team were patient and understanding, very helpful helpful especially when making table reservations at restaurants, you need a helpful team especially when you don't speak the local language.
reviews.title: All around superb

reviews.text: The rooms were decent in size, clean and newly renovated. Beds were comfortable.
reviews.title: As a single - its perfect

reviews.text: There's even internet for complimentary usage in the lobby area.
reviews.title: This is my home in Bangkok
